questions.question: It is …………………………… dark that I cannot see anything.
questions.description: We use so...that... to indicate cause and effect.

questions.question: He is …………………………… to understand this.
questions.description: Enough shows sufficiency. It goes after the adjective or adverb modified by it.

questions.question: What a charming girl ………………………….!
questions.description: In exclamations we do not use inversion. That means the subject goes before the verb.

questions.question: She is ………………………… young to go to school.
If you hurt the dog, it …………………………….. you.
questions.description: In the first conditional, use a simple present tense in the if clause and will + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If I had gone to university, I …………………………… a better job.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would/could/might + have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: If you were a billionaire, how ……………………………. you spend your time?
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If you had left that wasp alone, it …………………………………… you.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would/could/might + have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: It is no good ……………………………… to her.
It was careless …………………………… her to make that mistake.
It is wicked ………………………….. him to say such things.
